response: narrative=Marie Mitchell was last seen in the vicinity of 1-42 West Lodge Gardens, Alloa. Her sudden departure left her caregiver, Christine Lee, concerned, as Marie had unexpectedly left another location, 1 Arnothill, Falkirk. This happened amid signs of distress following an argument with a peer, Liam, prompting concern. Paul Whitehouse, a colleague of the involved foster care team, reported seeing Marie near Glensburgh Road, FK3 8XJ shortly thereafter. She was traced a few days later at a relative's home by her foster family, unharmed.
narrative=Marie Mitchell was seen acting erratically at the zoo, Blackston Road, Avonbridge.
narrative=Marie Mitchell, noted to act erratically and left job unexpectedly, found at cult location on Well Place, Dunblane by police.
narrative=Marie Mitchell vanished after attending extracurricular activities. A colleague, Tracy Martin, reported her missing when she didn't return home in West Murrayfield.

narrative=Marie Mitchell, a 12-year-old under the foster care of Kayleigh Douglas, was reported missing from her home at 1 Arnothill, Falkirk. Prior to her disappearance, she was noted to act erratically and had left her activities abruptly, which concerned her foster mother. On the day before her disappearance, Marie was last seen very close to 1 Goosecroft Road, Stirling. Friends and neighbors reported unusual behavior throughout that week. Despite early searches, she could not be located swiftly. After several days of intense police efforts, Marie was eventually traced at another location in Falkirk. The circumstances that led to her disappearance remain under investigation.

narrative=Marie Mitchell was last seen leaving a fast food restaurant after meeting her colleague, Brenda Murphy. Concerns arose when she did not return home. After days of searching, police found her safely at a friend's house.

narrative=Marie Mitchell, a 13-year-old, was last seen acting erratically by her foster mother, Kayleigh Douglas, before she wandered off from her home on Arnothill, Falkirk. Concerned, Kayleigh reached out to Brenda Murphy, a colleague of hers, to assist in the search. Marie was known for her curiosity and had previously expressed interest in visiting a zoo located near Greenside Street, Alloa. Additionally, recent conversations with her peer group hinted at a mysterious cult gathering near a secluded shed outside 1 Goosecroft Road, Stirling. After a tense few days and a city-wide search, a member of the public eventually discovered Marie safe at address 35 Kerse Road, Grangemouth.

narrative=Marie Mitchell unexpectedly left their residence at 1 Arnothill, Falkirk. Colleague Tracy Martin noted MP was distressed when leaving a job. Police located them a week later on Slamannan Road, safe and unharmed.
